column5: and was almost deserted by the early twentieth century. Until 1958 the city was a district of Mogi das Cruzes. Following the emancipation of the municipality that year

column1: Itaquaquecetuba's City Hall is located at 267 Vereador José Fernandes da Silva Avenue.
The name is derived from its first form in Tupi takwakisé-tube
column2: whose full meaning is "place of abundant bamboo sharp as knives".

column1: The city is served by Line 12 of CPTM (Companhia Paulista de Trens Metropolitanos). The commuter rail system has 3 train stations: Engenheiro Manoel
column2: Aracaré and Itaquaquecetuba. Local bus service is provided by CS Brasil and Intercity buses are also available connecting the city to Poá
column8: Suzano and São Paulo. Many bus companies operate such routes under permission of EMTU - Empresa Metropolitana de Transportes Urbanos de São Paulo
